Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the size of the crowd by stating that it covered most of the Halifax Mall, when in fact the photo was doctored and showed signs of manipulation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the photo provided as evidence was found to be manipulated and not authentic.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo accurately represents the size and presence of education advocates, when in fact it was doctored and not a true reflection of the crowd.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photo provided was doctored and not authentic.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by relying on a manipulated photo as evidence, which undermines its credibility.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide an alternative explanation for the manipulated photo.
